lead_paragraph: Sterling Marlin, Joe Nemechek and two crew chiefs have filed breach-of-contract suits against Ginn Racing and Dale Earnhardt Inc. All four lost their jobs when the two teams merged in late July, and in separate lawsuits filed last week in North Carolina they claim they are owed their salaries. Bobby Ginn, a land developer, bought the race team last summer and merged it with D.E.I. in late July. A week before the merger, he released Marlin, a two-time Daytona 500 winner, and Nemechek. The crew chiefs Richard Labbe and Peter Sospenzo lost their jobs after the merger.
